sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Portman Square Capital LLP Has $3.74 Million Stake in Lucid Group, Inc. $LCID
feed.summary: Portman Square Capital LLP significantly reduced its stake in Lucid Group, Inc. (NASDAQ:LCID) by 76% in the third quarter, now holding 157,056 shares valued at $3.74 million. This move comes as other institutional investors have also adjusted their holdings, with Lucid Group seeing weak quarterly results, missed analyst estimates, and a "Reduce" rating from MarketBeat due to negative margins and analyst downgrades.

feed.title: Lucid Stock (LCID) Updates: Price Moves, Gravity News, Analyst Forecasts, and What to Watch Before Monday’s Open
feed.summary: Lucid (LCID) stock closed Friday down 3.3% at $11.41, with investors balancing product progress, such as the cheaper Gravity Touring variant and robotaxi partnerships, against ongoing cash burn and supply-chain constraints. Analysts are split between "EV winter" concerns and optimism about Lucid's long-term optionality, as the company continues to rely on significant funding from Saudi Arabia's PIF. Investors should monitor year-end liquidity, EV demand changes, and future production/delivery updates before markets reopen.

feed.title: MarketBeat: Lucid Group (NASDAQ:LCID) Trading Down 3.4% - Here's Why
feed.summary: Lucid Group (NASDAQ:LCID) stock fell 3.4% on Friday, trading down to $11.41 after Morgan Stanley downgraded it to "underweight" and cut its price target to $10. The company reported missing Q3 earnings and revenue estimates, with deeply negative profitability metrics. Lucid Group's consensus analyst rating is "Reduce" with an average price target of $21.54, and institutional investors have recently made significant changes to their holdings.

feed.title: Lucid Recharged Announced by Lucid Motors
feed.summary: Lucid Motors has launched "Lucid Recharged," its first certified pre-owned (CPO) vehicle program, providing a new avenue for consumers to acquire Lucid electric vehicles. The program features single-owner vehicles with under 62,000 miles that undergo a rigorous 160-point inspection and reconditioning. Each Recharged vehicle comes with the balance of the original factory warranty plus an additional 12-month/12,000-mile manufacturer limited warranty, including roadside assistance and a verified service history.

feed.title: Lucid (LCID) Valuation Check After a Modest Share Price Rebound
feed.summary: Lucid Group (LCID) has seen a modest 6% rebound in its share price recently, sparking renewed interest from valuation-focused investors despite its significant year-to-date decline. The company's narrative fair value suggests it is 35.9% undervalued at $18.43, driven by anticipated growth from new EV platforms and advanced technology, though concerns remain about negative gross margins and capital reliance. While the market is skeptical, the upcoming launch of its mid-sized EV platform in late 2026 is expected to broaden its market and improve margins.

feed.title: Jim Cramer Shares Bearish Sentiment Toward Lucid Group
feed.summary: Jim Cramer expressed a bearish view on Lucid Group (NASDAQ: LCID), advising a caller to sell the stock and suggesting Rivian as a better alternative in the electric vehicle sector. Cramer indicated that for long-term investments, other options would make more sense than Lucid. The article also touches on Insider Monkey's focus on AI stocks with higher return potential.

feed.title: Jim Cramer Says Sell Lucid Stock Even as Shares Trade at Record Low
feed.summary: Jim Cramer recommended investors sell Lucid Motors shares, despite the stock trading near its all-time low. This recommendation comes amidst prior skepticism from Cramer, even as Lucid addresses challenges like software problems and supply chain disruptions. Lucid shares have fallen significantly in the past year, though the company is attempting to incentivize sales with year-end lease offers.

feed.title: Why Lucid Group (LCID) Is Down 5.7% After “EV Winter” Concerns Deepen Around Gravity SUV Launch
feed.summary: Lucid Group's stock (LCID) is down 5.7% following deepening "EV winter" concerns, highlighted by interim CEO Marc Winterhoff's acknowledgment of slowing EV demand and a Morgan Stanley downgrade. The company is preparing for Gravity SUV deliveries and expanding programs, but its reliance on external funding and persistent losses remain key risks amidst softer demand. Despite a recent $2.0 billion delayed draw term loan facility, investors are focused on the company's liquidity, production ramp, and long-term financial viability.

feed.title: Lucid's big SUV arrives with high expectations, and big risks
feed.summary: Lucid Motors is launching its new Gravity SUV amidst high expectations and significant financial challenges, including supply chain shortages and substantial net losses. The company aims to compete in the more popular SUV segment, following the success of its Air sedan, despite a tough EV market and mounting cash burn. Lucid also plans a more affordable SUV and is investing in self-driving technology.

feed.title: Lucid Group (NASDAQ:LCID) Trading Up 3.2% - Here's Why
feed.summary: Lucid Group (NASDAQ:LCID) saw its stock rise 3.2% to $11.82 on Friday, despite trading volume being 33% below its average. This rebound occurred amidst a generally negative analyst sentiment, with a consensus "Reduce" rating and an average target price of $21.54, reflecting recent downgrades and a significant target price cut by Morgan Stanley to $10. The company recently missed Q3 earnings and revenue estimates, reporting a substantial net loss despite year-over-year revenue growth.

feed.title: Lucid Stock (LCID) Today: Latest News, Analyst Forecasts, and What Could Move Lucid Group Shares Next
feed.summary: Lucid Group (LCID) stock is facing a push-pull between strong product momentum, including the Gravity SUV ramp and recent awards, and persistent financial challenges like cash burn and supply constraints. Despite a recent 52-week low, the company received significant third-party validation for its vehicles and launched a certified pre-owned program to boost demand. Analysts show deep disagreement on Lucid's future, with some acknowledging its technological optionality while others remain cautious due to financial headwinds.

feed.title: Lucid Group (NASDAQ:LCID) Trading Up 2.9% - Still a Buy?
feed.summary: Lucid Group (NASDAQ:LCID) shares traded up 2.9% intraday to $11.45 on Thursday, with roughly 7.41 million shares exchanged. Analysts have a "Reduce" consensus rating with an average target of $21.54, and the company recently missed quarterly earnings and revenue expectations. Institutional investors and hedge funds have shown activity in LCID stock.

feed.title: Lucid (LCID) reassures investors on growth plans after its stock hits a new low
feed.summary: Lucid Motors (LCID) is reassuring investors about its growth plans after its stock recently hit an all-time low. Despite headwinds and supply chain issues, the company is focused on execution, has strong liquidity, and expects to ramp up production of its Gravity SUV and launch a new midsize platform in late 2026. Lucid aims to produce 18,000 vehicles this year and plans to reveal more growth strategies at its Capital Market Day in Q1.

feed.title: Lucid Executive Addresses Shareholders as Stock Bounces from Record Low
feed.summary: A Lucid Motors executive addressed shareholders after the stock hit a record low, emphasizing the company's strong liquidity, including a $2 billion credit facility, and refinancing efforts. The executive highlighted upcoming product releases like the midsize vehicle platform and recent accolades for the Lucid Air and Gravity models, assuring investors of disciplined capital deployment and future growth. Despite a challenging EV market and production guidance reductions, Lucid aims for renewed sales records and global expansion.

feed.title: Morgan Stanley Downgrades To Equal Weight On Lucid Group, Inc. (LCID)
feed.summary: Morgan Stanley downgraded Lucid Group, Inc. (LCID) to Underweight from Equal Weight and trimmed its price target to $10 from $30, citing an "EV winter" projected to last until next year. The firm's assessment for the auto industry in 2026 indicates a more cautious stance, with a moderately more favorable forecast for internal combustion engines and hybrid vehicles. Lucid executives also reported a distinct slowdown in EV demand in the US and Europe, despite the company working through its backlog.

feed.title: Set as Title
feed.summary: Lucid Group (NASDAQ:LCID) shares fell by 2.5% to $11.52, with trading volume significantly below average, reflecting continued investor concern. Analyst sentiment has weakened, leading to downgraded ratings and price targets, contributing to a "Reduce" consensus rating. The company's fundamentals remain strained, with quarterly earnings and revenue missing expectations and a negative net margin.

feed.title: Lucid Group: Willing To Bite On Extended Runway, Increasing Market Share (Rating Upgrade)
feed.summary: Lucid Group (LCID) has been upgraded to a "Buy" due to improved liquidity, extending through Q1 2027 with $5.5 billion in capacity, and reduced FY25 capital expenditure forecasts. The company demonstrated strong delivery growth, up 47% year-over-year in Q3, outperforming competitors like Tesla and Rivian, which suggests increasing brand momentum ahead of its mid-size SUV launch. LCID's current valuation, trading at less than a third of Tesla's forward revenue multiple, presents a potential value opportunity with manageable near-term risks.

feed.title: Lucid Group stock hits 52-week low at $11.46
feed.summary: Lucid Group (LCID) stock has fallen to a new 52-week low of $11.46, marking a 58.24% decline over the past year due to market pressures and investor concerns. Despite launching a certified pre-owned program and a new SUV model, and raising $975 million through convertible notes, the electric vehicle manufacturer faces significant industry headwinds. Analysts like Morgan Stanley have downgraded the stock, citing concerns about its path to profitability.

feed.title: Lucid Gravity SUV and Lucid Air Sedan Named to Car and Driver's Prestigious 10Best for 2026
feed.summary: Lucid Group announced that both its Lucid Gravity SUV and Lucid Air Sedan have been selected for Car and Driver's 2026 10Best lists. The Lucid Gravity made the 10Best Trucks & SUVs list in its first year of eligibility, while the Lucid Air earned its spot on the 10Best Cars list for the third consecutive year. This recognition highlights Lucid's focus on innovation, engineering excellence, and providing an unparalleled driving experience with advanced electric vehicles.

feed.title: Introducing Lucid Recharged™, Lucid Motors' Certified Pre-Owned Vehicle Program
feed.summary: Lucid Group, Inc. has launched Lucid Recharged™, its first certified pre-owned vehicle program, making its advanced electric vehicles more accessible. These CPO vehicles undergo a 160-point inspection and come with extended warranties and roadside assistance, offering customers peace of mind and access to potential upgrades. This initiative provides a new way for consumers to experience Lucid's innovative performance and design.

feed.title: Lucid is now selling ‘reborn’ certified pre-owned EVs for the first time
feed.summary: Lucid Group (LCID) has launched its first certified pre-owned EV program, "Lucid Recharged," offering "reborn" vehicles with a Lucid-backed reconditioning process and additional warranty coverage. These vehicles undergo a 160+-point inspection, must be under 6 years old, have fewer than 62,000 miles, and come with an extended manufacturer limited warranty and roadside assistance. Lucid is also providing various discounts on new Lucid Air and Gravity models for a limited time.

feed.title: Introducing Lucid Recharged™, Lucid Motors' Certified Pre-Owned Vehicle Program
feed.summary: Lucid Group, Inc. has launched Lucid Recharged™, its first certified pre-owned vehicle program, offering a new avenue for consumers to acquire Lucid electric vehicles. These vehicles undergo rigorous inspections and reconditioning, come with warranty coverage, and an option for feature upgrades like the DreamDrive® Pro system. The program aims to make Lucid's advanced EVs more accessible while ensuring quality and peace of mind for buyers.

feed.title: Lucid Group (NASDAQ: LCID) debuts Lucid Recharged certified pre-owned EV program
feed.summary: Lucid Group (NASDAQ: LCID) launched "Lucid Recharged," its first certified pre-owned (CPO) vehicle program, offering single-owner EVs with less than 62,000 miles. These vehicles undergo a 160-point inspection and reconditioning, coming with an extended manufacturer warranty. This initiative aims to make Lucid's advanced electric vehicles more accessible to a wider range of customers.

feed.title: Lucid launches 'Lucid Recharged' program to sell certified, pre-owned EVs (LCID:NASDAQ)
feed.summary: Lucid Group (LCID) has launched "Lucid Recharged," a new program for selling certified, pre-owned electric vehicles at its dealerships. The eligible vehicles must have had only one owner and fewer than 62,000 miles, and each will undergo a 160+ point inspection process.

feed.title: Introducing Lucid Recharged™, Lucid Motors' Certified Pre-Owned Vehicle Program
feed.summary: Lucid Group, Inc. has launched Lucid Recharged™, its first certified pre-owned vehicle program, making its advanced electric vehicles more accessible. This program offers single-owner vehicles with less than 62,000 miles, which undergo a rigorous 160-point inspection and reconditioning using Lucid-approved parts. Vehicles also come with extended warranty coverage, roadside assistance, and a verified service history.

feed.title: Linden Advisors LP Invests $9.89 Million in Lucid Group, Inc. $LCID
feed.summary: Linden Advisors LP has acquired a new stake in Lucid Group, Inc. (NASDAQ:LCID), purchasing 4,684,700 shares valued at approximately $9.89 million, representing about 0.15% of the company. This investment comes amidst mixed-to-negative analyst sentiment, with an average target price of $21.54 and a recent downgrade from Morgan Stanley to "underweight" with a $10 target. Lucid recently missed its earnings and revenue estimates, reporting an EPS of ($2.65) and revenue of $336.6 million, despite a 68.3% year-over-year revenue increase.

feed.title: Marex Group plc Purchases Shares of 3,608,134 Lucid Group, Inc. $LCID
feed.summary: Marex Group plc has acquired a significant stake in Lucid Group, purchasing over 3.6 million shares valued at approximately $7.61 million in Q2, representing 0.12% of the company. This comes amid mixed analyst sentiments, with an average "Reduce" rating and a target price of $21.54, after Lucid Group missed its Q3 EPS and revenue estimates, reporting a deeply negative net margin. Other institutional investors have also adjusted their positions in LCID, with a notable portion of the stock now owned by hedge funds and institutions.

feed.title: Lucid Group (NASDAQ:LCID) Stock Price Down 1.2% - Here's What Happened
feed.summary: Lucid Group's stock (NASDAQ:LCID) experienced a 1.2% decline in mid-day trading to $12.83 on light volume, significantly below its 50-day and 200-day moving averages. This drop follows multiple brokerage downgrades and missed quarterly earnings expectations, with a reported EPS of -$2.65 against an estimated -$2.32 and revenue of $336.6 million against $378.4 million. Despite increased institutional investment, analysts maintain an average "Reduce" rating with a consensus target price of $21.54.

feed.title: Lucid (LCID) is ‘on track’ to build 18,000 EVs this year as production hits big milestone
feed.summary: Lucid Motors (LCID) is projected to achieve the lower end of its yearly production target, aiming for 18,000 EVs, despite a recent slowdown in demand following the expiration of the $7,500 EV tax credit in the US. The company plans to double its previous quarterly production in Q4 to meet this goal, supported by increased manufacturing capacity and the upcoming Gravity SUV deliveries. Furthermore, Lucid will introduce a new midsize platform in late 2026, starting with a crossover SUV around $50,000, to expand its market presence.

feed.title: Lucid (LCID) Valuation Check After Prolonged Share Price Weakness and Robotaxi Growth Hopes
feed.summary: Lucid Group (LCID) has experienced significant share price weakness despite growing revenue, with its stock down over the past month and year. While a newly announced partnership with Uber and Nuro for robotaxi deployment suggests substantial future growth and a narrative fair value of $18.43 (undervalued), the company faces challenges with persistent negative margins and a high price-to-sales ratio compared to its industry peers. Investors are left to weigh the potential for a growth story against execution risks and ambitious valuation assumptions.

feed.title: Lucid (LCID) is ‘on a good track’ to build 18,000 EVs this year as Gravity output ramps up
feed.summary: Lucid Motors is on track to meet its revised goal of building 18,000 EVs in 2025, despite cutting its initial year-end production target due to a changing market and external factors. Interim CEO Marc Winterhoff confirmed the company is "on a good track" to hit the lower end of its goal, with the new Gravity SUV set to significantly contribute to Q4 production. While demand has slowed following the expiration of the $7,500 EV tax credit, Lucid's CFO reported "constant and very pleasing improvement in terms of market share" and encouraging signs for Q4.

feed.title: Rhumbline Advisers Purchases 87,907 Shares of Lucid Group, Inc. $LCID
feed.summary: Rhumbline Advisers increased its stake in Lucid Group, Inc. by 10.8% in the second quarter, acquiring an additional 87,907 shares to hold a total of 902,632 shares valued at $1.905 million. Despite this, institutional investors collectively own about 75.17% of LCID, with other significant holders including Vanguard Group Inc. and Swiss National Bank. Lucid Group continues to face challenges, having missed quarterly earnings and revenue estimates, remaining unprofitable, and carrying a consensus "Reduce" rating with a target price of $21.54 from analysts.

feed.title: Lucid CEO Sees Definite EV Demand Slowdown in US and Europe
feed.summary: Lucid Group Inc.'s interim CEO, Marc Winterhoff, acknowledges a clear deceleration in electric vehicle demand across the US and Europe, attributing it to the expiration of federal tax credits impacting Q3 purchases. Despite this slowdown, Lucid expects to produce around 18,000 EVs this year, meeting the lower end of its forecast. This comes as analysts downgrade Lucid, Rivian, and Tesla shares, anticipating an "EV winter" to continue through next year.

feed.title: Lucid Group Stock Extends Losses Tuesday Following 'EV Winter' Downgrade
feed.summary: Lucid Group (NASDAQ: LCID) shares continued to fall on Tuesday after Morgan Stanley downgraded the stock to Underweight, citing an "EV winter" and concerns about Lucid's path to profitability. Analyst Andrew Percoco slashed his price target to $10 from $30, projecting the company won't reach gross profit breakeven until 2028 and may require a significant equity raise. This bearish outlook, compounded by high short interest and a recent executive departure, has pushed LCID near its 52-week low.

feed.title: Lucid’s Former Product Chief Sues Company for Discrimination
feed.summary: Eric Bach, former Senior Vice President of Product and Chief Engineer at Lucid Motors, has filed a federal lawsuit against the company alleging discrimination, retaliation, and wrongful termination. The lawsuit claims that Lucid's HR department targeted Bach after a Senior Director of Human Resources referred to him as a "German Nazi," and that Lucid failed to take appropriate remedial action. Bach, who was fired on November 5, 2025, is seeking compensatory and punitive damages, along with attorney's fees.

feed.title: Lucid Motors’ former chief engineer sues for wrongful termination and discrimination
feed.summary: Eric Bach, the former chief engineer of Lucid Motors, has filed a federal lawsuit against the company for wrongful termination, discrimination, and retaliation. Bach claims he was stripped of responsibilities and eventually fired after an HR investigation into workplace culture, during which a top HR executive allegedly referred to him as a "German Nazi." This lawsuit adds to Lucid Motors' recent executive turnover and financial challenges as it works to ramp up production of new vehicles.

feed.title: Lucid Group Stock Is Sliding Monday: What's Driving The Action?
feed.summary: Lucid Group (NASDAQ: LCID) shares are falling after Morgan Stanley downgraded the stock to Underweight with a reduced price target of $10, citing concerns over the company's extended timeline to profitability and significant dilution risk. The luxury EV maker is not expected to reach gross profit breakeven until 2028, with EBIT losses persisting until 2031, compounded by a need to raise approximately $2 billion in equity by mid-2026. This downgrade adds to existing pressures from a wider-than-expected Q3 loss, executive departures, and an $875 million convertible note offering.

feed.title: Lucid Interim CEO to Speak at the 53rd Annual NASDAQ Investor Conference held in Association with Morgan Stanley
feed.summary: Lucid Group, Inc. announced that Interim CEO Marc Winterhoff will participate in a fireside chat at the 53rd Annual NASDAQ Investor Conference held in Association with Morgan Stanley on Wednesday, December 10, 2025. The session, scheduled for 11:30 am GMT (6:30 am EST), will be webcast live on Lucid's investor relations website and a replay will be available for 90 days. Lucid, a Silicon Valley-based technology company, focuses on creating advanced electric vehicles like the Lucid Air and Lucid Gravity SUV.

feed.title: Morgan Stanley downgrades Lucid stock to Underweight on profitability concerns
feed.summary: Morgan Stanley has downgraded Lucid Group Inc. (NASDAQ:LCID) to Underweight and significantly cut its price target to $10.00 from $30.00, citing concerns over the luxury EV maker's prolonged path to profitability, which they don't foresee until 2028. The investment bank also highlighted a substantial dilution risk, estimating Lucid will need to raise approximately $2 billion in equity by mid-2026. Despite these concerns, Morgan Stanley acknowledged Lucid's premium positioning and strong battery efficiency as positive factors.

feed.title: Lucid Group Stock Is Sliding Monday: What's Driving The Action?
feed.summary: Lucid Group (NASDAQ: LCID) shares are down after Morgan Stanley downgraded the stock to Underweight, slashing its price target to $10 from $30 due to concerns over delayed profitability and significant dilution risk. The analyst projects Lucid won't reach gross profit breakeven until 2028, requiring an estimated $2 billion in equity by mid-2026. This comes as LCID is already down 58% year-to-date amid wider-than-expected losses, executive departures, and convertible note offerings.

feed.title: Lucid Group (LCID) Stock: Faces Steep 2025 Declines Despite Record Q3 Deliveries
feed.summary: Despite recording strong operational milestones like increased Q3 deliveries and revenue, Lucid Group's (LCID) stock has fallen significantly in 2025 due to deep losses, cash burn, and ongoing investor caution. The company is banking on the Gravity SUV's momentum and future midsize EV plans to alleviate concerns, but financing risks and potential dilution remain a challenge for its stock performance.

feed.title: Worst CEOs of the Year: Marc Winterhoff of Lucid
feed.summary: Marc Winterhoff, interim CEO of Lucid Group Inc. (NASDAQ: LCID), is being considered for the worst CEO of the year due to the company's significant strategic missteps and poor financial performance. The luxury EV maker's shares have dropped 53% this year, and its reliance on high-priced vehicles has alienated a market largely looking for more affordable options, pushing the company towards potential ruin. Lucid's future appears bleak, especially with the expiration of EV tax credits and the long timeline for its more affordable models.

feed.title: HYROX and Lucid Announce First Automotive Partnership in Europe
feed.summary: HYROX, the World Series of Fitness Racing, has partnered with California EV company Lucid, marking Lucid's first major automotive partnership in Europe for the 2025/26 season. This collaboration unifies two brands driven by excellence and performance, with Lucid's vehicles featured at all remaining HYROX events in the DACH season. The partnership aims to inspire communities through a shared passion for innovation and active lifestyles, connecting fitness enthusiasts with car connoisseurs.

feed.title: Is Lucid Motors a Millionaire-Maker?
feed.summary: Lucid Motors (NASDAQ: LCID) is an electric vehicle upstart attempting to compete in a highly competitive automotive sector now dominated by major players also producing EVs. While Lucid's production has grown, its financial statements show significant losses, with the company losing money on every car made and having limited cash reserves. Due to high competition, substantial financial losses, and the risk of share dilution, investing in Lucid is currently very high-risk, and investors should exercise extreme caution.

feed.title: Lucid (NASDAQ: LCID) Stock Price Prediction and Forecast 2025-2030 (Dec 2025)
feed.summary: 24/7 Wall St. provides a stock price prediction for Lucid (NASDAQ: LCID) through 2030, despite the company's past production issues, weak sales, and operating losses. The forecast suggests significant upside potential, driven by Saudi government backing, strategic price cuts to compete with Tesla, and the company's ongoing technological advancements. However, challenges like high production costs, declining demand for EVs, and the question of sustained funding from the Saudi Public Investment Fund remain critical factors.

feed.title: Lucid Group (LCID) Stock Jumps Tuesday: What's Going On?
feed.summary: Lucid Group (LCID) shares traded higher on a Tuesday, despite significant headwinds including a wider-than-expected third-quarter loss, missed revenue forecasts, and concerns about dilution from a convertible senior note offering. The stock's positive momentum is attributed to improved risk appetite, retreating Treasury yields, and increased bets on Federal Reserve rate cuts, which benefit high-growth stocks. Additionally, Lucid remains a heavily shorted stock, amplifying upward movements when bearish investors cover their positions.

feed.title: Lucid Group (LCID) Q3 2025 Revenue Jumps 68% Despite $718M EBITDA Loss
feed.summary: Lucid Group Inc. (NASDAQ: LCID) reported a significant 68% year-over-year revenue increase to $337 million in Q3 2025, alongside a 47% rise in vehicle shipments to 4,078 units. Despite this revenue growth, the company recorded an adjusted EBITDA loss of $718 million. Benchmark recently reduced Lucid's price target from $70 to $30 but maintained a Buy rating, following the company's announcement of pricing $875 million in senior unsecured convertible notes and intending to use the proceeds for general corporate operations and to buy back 2026 notes.

feed.title: Lucid Gravity Touring: The Luxury Electric SUV Designed Without Compromise, Now Starting at $79,900
feed.summary: Lucid Motors has launched the Lucid Gravity Touring, expanding its electric SUV lineup with a starting price of $79,900. This new model offers a blend of luxury, performance, and efficiency, featuring a 337-mile EPA-estimated range and fast-charging capabilities. The Gravity Touring, available for order now, will make its public debut at the 2025 Los Angeles International Auto Show.

feed.title: Lucid Group, Inc. Announces Closing of Private Offering of $975.0 Million of Convertible Senior Notes Due 2031
feed.summary: Lucid Group, Inc. announced the closing of a $975.0 million private offering of convertible senior notes due in November 2031, which included the full exercise of the initial purchasers' option. The net proceeds of approximately $962.4 million were used primarily to repurchase $755.7 million of existing 1.25% convertible senior notes due 2026, strengthening the company's balance sheet for long-term growth. The remaining proceeds will be used for general corporate purposes, with flexibility for cash, stock, or combined settlements to manage potential dilution.

feed.title: Lucid Announces Third Quarter 2025 Financial Results
feed.summary: Lucid Group, Inc. announced its financial results for the third quarter ended September 30, 2025, reporting revenue of $336.6 million on deliveries of 4,078 vehicles. The company also highlighted a strategic collaboration with NVIDIA for Level 4 autonomous driving technology and an increase in its delayed draw term loan facility with the Public Investment Fund to approximately $2.0 billion. Lucid emphasizes its focus on production ramp-up, cost management, and global expansion, while maintaining a strong liquidity position.
